briefdescription.para: Number of elements in a C array.
Number of milliseconds in a second.
Number of microseconds in a second.
Number of microseconds in a millisecond.
Number of nanoseconds in a second.
Number of nanoseconds in a millisecond.
Number of nanoseconds in a microsecond.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the object to initialize.
Pointer to the handler function for the callback. If this pointer is NULL, the callback handler will be a no-op.
Pointer to the state that will be passed to the callback handler function.

simplesect.para: the GG_GenericCallbackHandler interface for the initialized object.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: do not use as a secure source of entropy, this is only for non-secure pseudo random number generation.
Obtain an array of random bytes.
NOTE: do not use as a secure source of entropy, this is only for non-secure pseudo random byte generation.

parameterdescription.para: Memory in which to store the random bytes.
Size of the buffer to fill.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *input, size_t input_size, char *output, size_t *output_size, bool url_safe)
memberdef.name: GG_Base64_Encode

detaileddescription.para: Encode a byte array into a base64 string.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a variable containing on input the size of the output buffer and on output the number of bytes written. If the buffer size is too small, the buffer size needed is returned instead.
Boolean indicating whether or not to use the URL-safe character set instead of the standard one.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the input could be encoded, or GG_ERROR_NOT_ENOUGH_SPACE if the output buffer was too small.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *input, size_t input_size, uint8_t *output, size_t *output_size, bool url_safe)
memberdef.name: GG_Base64_Decode

detaileddescription.para: Decode a base64 string into a byte array.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the input string (if the string is null-terminated, passing 0 will automatically measure the length of the string).
Pointer to a variable containing on input the size if the output buffer and on output the number of bytes written. If the buffer size is too small, the buffer size needed is returned instead.
Boolean indicating whether or not to use the URL-safe character set instead of the standard one.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the input could be decoded, GG_ERROR_NOT_ENOUGH_SPACE if the output buffer was too small, or GG_ERROR_INVALID_FORMAT if the input is not valid base64.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *bytes, size_t bytes_size, char *hex, bool uppercase)
memberdef.name: GG_BytesToHex

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *bytes, size_t bytes_size, GG_String *hex, bool uppercase)
memberdef.name: GG_BytesToHexString

detaileddescription.para: Convert a 16-bit integer to 2 bytes, using big-endian byte order.
Convert a 32-bit integer to 4 bytes, using big-endian byte order.
Convert a 64-bit integer to 8 bytes, using big-endian byte order.
Convert a 16-bit integer value to 2 bytes, using big-endian byte order.
Convert a 32-bit integer value to 4 bytes, using big-endian byte order.
Convert a 64-bit integer value to 8 bytes, using big-endian byte order.
Convert a 16-bit integer to 2 bytes, using little-endian byte order.
Convert a 32-bit integer to 4 bytes, using little-endian byte order.
Convert a 64-bit integer to 8 bytes, using big-endian byte order.
Convert a 16-bit integer value to 2 bytes, using little-endian byte order.
Convert a 32-bit integer value to 4 bytes, using little-endian byte order.
Convert a 64-bit integer value to 8 bytes, using little-endian byte order.

briefdescription.para: General purpose utility functions and macros.
